designer
Class DesignerComponent

java.lang.Object
  designer.DesignerComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ButtonComponent, LabelComponent, TextAreaComponent, TextFieldComponent
public abstract class DesignerComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

Constructor Detail

DesignerComponent

public DesignerComponent(javax.swing.JComponent comp)
Creates a DesignerComponent using the given JComponent as the component to display when designing.

Parameters:
comp - The JComponent to display.
Method Detail

isLayoutMode

public boolean isLayoutMode()
Gets the boolean indicating if this DesignerComponent is in Layout Mode.

Returns:
Returns true if this DesignerComponent is set to Layout Mode, false if it is set to Designer Mode.

setLayoutMode

public void setLayoutMode(boolean layoutMode)
Sets the mode of this DesignerComponent.

Parameters:
layoutMode - If true this DesignerComponent will be set to Layout Mode. If false it will be set to Designer Mode.

setHorizontalReference

public void setHorizontalReference(DesignerComponent ref)
Sets the horizontal reference for this DesignerComponent. This reference will be used when creating the constraints for the SpringLayout that has been designed.

Parameters:
ref - The DesignerComponent acting as the horizontal reference.

setVerticalReference

public void setVerticalReference(DesignerComponent ref)
Sets the vertical reference for this DesignerComponent. This reference will be used when creating the constraints for the SpringLayout that has been designed.

Parameters:
ref - The DesignerComponent acting as the vertical reference.

getHorizontalReference

public DesignerComponent getHorizontalReference()
Gets the horizontal reference for this DesignerComponent

Returns:
The horizontal reference.

getVerticalReference

public DesignerComponent getVerticalReference()
Gets the vertical reference for this DesignerComponent

Returns:
The vertical reference.

getComponent

public javax.swing.JComponent getComponent()
Gets the JComponent associated with this DesignerComponent. This JComponent represents what will be displayed in Designer Mode, as well as what Class will be used when generating the SpringLayout.

Returns:
The JComponent used by this DesignerComponent.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
A quick shortcut method which implements the getName method of the JComponent associated with this DesignerComponent. Used for convenience.

Returns:
The name of the JComponent.

addPropertyChangeListener

public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener pcl)
Adds the given PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. A PropertyChangeEvent will be fired under one of two conditions. The first is if a property in the Properties associated with this DesignerComponent is changed. In this case the PropertyChangeEvent will contain the name of the changed property, as well as its old and new values. The intent is that a PropertiesPanel object will be listening for this event and update its displayed properties accordingly.

The second is if the JComponent associated with this DesignerComponent becomes selected while the in Design Mode. In this case, the PropertyChangeEvent will contain the value of SELECTED_FIELD as the propertyName and the Properties object associated with this DesignerComopnent as the newValue. The intent is that a PropertiesPanel object will be listening for this event and load the Properties when the JComponent becomes selected.

Parameters:
pcl - The PropertyChangeListener to add. This listener should be a PropertiesPanel object.

removePropertyChangeListener

public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener pcl)
Removes the given PropertyChangeListener from this listener list.

Parameters:
pcl -

propertyChange

public void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent pce)
Specified by:
propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

setProperty

public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                        java.lang.String value)
Sets the given property to a new value using the Properties object associated with this DesignerComponent. Using this method will fire a PropertyChangeEvent containing information about the changed property.

Parameters:
propertyName - The name of the property to change. This value should be accessed using one of the static fields associated with a specific DesignerComopnent.
value - The new value of the property.

getProperties

public abstract java.util.Properties getProperties()
Gets the Properties object associated with this DesignerComponent. Difference JComponent objects will have different properties associated with them, so this method should return varying properties based on what kind of JComponent is represented by the DesignerComponent.
